Country-soul combo Phantom Limb draw heartily from Americana roots, while adding moody musical undertones from their native Bristol. Since their 2004 formation, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve deservedly earned praise for their live shows and, in particular, the exhilarating vocals of frontwoman Yolanda Quartey. 
The Pines follows their 2008 self-titled debut album and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s still QuarteyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s singing that sets these melodies apart. She adds both grit and tender depth to lines such as Ã¢â‚¬ËœMy knees arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t made for kneeling at your feetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ (from the gospel-styled Tumbling Down) and she impressively rips into IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll Have Mercy, but the compositions themselves seem rather polite. 
The music is easy on the ears and expertly played but it feels like Phantom Limb are missing a raw edge here.
